On the morning of the new year, many people set
new goals for themselves
in  That includes exercising to
improve your health. The latest research results
in the UK show that
just walking briskly for about 20 minutes every day and then
practicing balance and muscle strengthening exercises
at home will bring benefits.  for cardiovascular
and general health
In a study, scientists
at the University of
London evaluated the relationship between
different types of movement over a
24-hour period on cardiovascular health.
They collected data.  from 15,000 people
around the world and classify
activities by intensity from
heart-rate-increasing vigorous activities to
light activities and finally
non-energy-consuming activities such as sitting
and just sleeping.  Replacing 5 to 10 minutes of
sitting or standing with activities such as
walking and cycling can
provide cardiovascular health benefits.
Researchers also emphasize the
importance of physical activity.  maintaining balance
and flexibility as people age,
including SWAT standing up, sitting down,
bending the knee, standing on one leg, and even
walking in a straight line. The research team
also encourages the integration of movement
into activities.  Daily activities such as carrying
